name: Blame Chaucer
description: This course takes a close look at some of the bawdy, irreverent, and even dangerous texts written in fourteenth-century England by Geoffrey Chaucer. As he recounts erotic dreams, tells the story of a faithless woman inÿTroilus and Criseyde, and narrates tales told on a riotous, drunken pilgrimage inÿThe Canterbury Tales, Chaucer repeatedly tells his readers not to blame him for what he writes. Students in this course will ask: who is to blame, if not the author himself? [36L]
prerequisites: 1.0 credit in ENG and 3.0 additional credits.
